articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Pakistani President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Pakistani President
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Asif Ali Zardari, president of Pakistan, in connection with the recent flood that hit several regions of Pakistan, claiming many casualties and material losses.
					Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the residents in the flood-stricken regions, Kim hoped that the Pakistani government would eradicate the aftermath of flood and bring the living of the flood victims to normal as soon as possible.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Singaporean President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Singaporean President
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to S. R. Nathan, president of Singapore, on Monday on the occasion of its 45th national day.
					 Expressing satisfaction over the fact that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have recently grown stronger in politics, economy and several other fields, Kim in the message wished the president greater success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country and promotion of the people's welfare.

articles.title: Chinese Public Security Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese Public Security Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A Chinese public security delegation headed by Liu Jing, executive vice-minister of Public Security, arrived here on Sunday by train.

articles.title: Chinese Youth Friendship Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese Youth Friendship Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A Chinese youth friendship delegation led by Zhou Zhangkui, secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League of China, arrived here Monday by air.

articles.title: Floral Basket and Gift from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Gift from Japanese Delegation
Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a gift by the visiting delegation of the Japanese Youth Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					The floral basket and gift were conveyed to an official concerned on Monday by Nobuaki Endo who is leading the delegation.

articles.title: Exhibition of Achievements in Public Health Held
articles.content:
Exhibition of Achievements in Public Health Held
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The 13th national exhibition of scientific and technological achievements in the field of public health was held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition in Pyongyang between August 2 and 9.
					 On display there were products, diagrams and multi-media on at least 2,500 scientific and technological achievements presented by scientists and technicians and medical workers of healthcare institutions and enterprises at various levels from across the country. 
					
					 Brisk scientific and technological public presentations and information exchange and other events took place while the exhibition was under way.
					
					 Appreciated by the participants were such papers of great value in preventive treatment and diagnosis as "medicine for the prevention of bird flu symptom on human beings." 
					
					 Also drawing the attention of participants were such medical appliances and medicines as "portable digital CO measuring device", "operation instrument for liver excision" and a variety of anticancer injection.
					
					 A closing ceremony was held on Monday.

articles.title: Anniversary of ASEAN Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of ASEAN Observed
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A reception was given on Monday by diplomatic envoys of ASEAN countries here on the occasion of the 43rd founding anniversary of the ASEAN. 
					 Present there on invitation were DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and officials concerned. 
					
					 On hand were Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak, Cambodian Ambassador Chhorn Hay, Vietnamese Ambassador Le Van Cu, Malaysian Ambassador Rahimi Bin Harun, Indonesian Charge d'affaires ad Interim Fitri Riyanti and staff members of embassies here. 
					
					 The Lao ambassador in his speech at the reception said that the ASEAN member nations, out of their common responsibility for comprehensive security, have made efforts to make the organization a powerful and future-oriented body, he said.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the DPRK foreign minister visited Southeast Asian countries and participated in the ARF, adding that this is a clear proof of the efforts exerted by the DPRK to boost the multilateral cooperation with ASEAN countries.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun voiced the expectation that the ASEAN would as ever fulfill its mission and role as a prestigious organization united closer in the idea of independence, equality, mutual respect and non-interference in internal affairs. 
					
					 He declared that the DPRK government would continue to make efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with ASEAN countries.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Taedonggang Fruit Farm
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Taedonggang Fruit Farm
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys and staff members of embassies of ASEAN countries here visited the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm on the outskirts of Pyongyang Monday on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of the ASEAN. 
					After being briefed on the vast modern young orchard built thanks to the warm care shown by General Secretary Kim Jong Il for the Korean people to provide them with fresh fruits all the year round, they enjoyed a bird's-eye view of the farm. They were deeply moved by the devoted labor drive of its builders.
					
					Rahimi Bin Harun, ambassador of Malaysia to the DPRK, said that the Korean people built the modern fruit production centre, convinced of a rosy future.

articles.title: Converting and Drawing Processes Go Operational
articles.content:
Converting and Drawing Processes Go Operational
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- New modern converting and drawing processes have gone operational at the February 8 Vinalon Complex. 
					 The completion of these processes laid a foundation for keeping the production of quality vinalon thread and fabric going at high rate so that they may contribute to developing the nation's economy and improving the standard of people's living. 
					
					 The officials and workers of the complex have pushed forward the projects for reconstructing buildings and infrastructural network and others simultaneously since they kicked off the projects for the above-said processes early in May, thereby completing the projects much earlier than scheduled. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the complex has settled scientific and technological issues in touch with scientists of the Hamhung Chemical Industrial Designing Institute and the Hamhung Branch of the State Academy of Sciences and carried out the installing of dozens of equipment in a short span of time.

articles.title: Foreign Children Campers Enjoy "Arirang"
articles.content:
Foreign Children Campers Enjoy "Arirang"
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The 25th batch of campers of the Songdowon International Children's Camp appreciated the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang". Describing it as a fantastic performance, campers from different countries expressed their admiration.
					 Zhaoli, head of the group of Chinese campers, said that the performance is the acme and the Korean people are demonstrating before the whole world their dignity under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Nataliya Andreyevskaya, head of the group of Russian campers (sixth group), said that she keenly felt through the performance that each country and nation can become glorious and powerful only when they have a great leader.
					
					 Xianghui, deputy head of the Chinese group, said: What much impressed us was the section of "Arirang for Friendship". This section made us more deeply feel that the Sino-DPRK friendship is durable.
					
					 Nataliya Tatarina, a member of the Russian group (first group), said: Seeing 100,000 performers act as one, I keenly felt once again how strong the single-minded unity of the DPRK is.
					
					 She stressed that no force on earth can match the strength of the Korean people closely united around Kim Jong Il, the sun of the 21st century.

articles.title: "Arirang", Cultural Asset of Humankind
articles.content:
"Arirang", Cultural Asset of Humankind
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", a winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, is going on at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang, drawing many local and foreign people.
					 "Arirang", reflecting the history of the Korean nation and the present and future of Songun Korea in a unique way, is considered to be a masterpiece of the 21st century. 
					
					 It, performed by 100,000 persons, is admired by the spectators for its kaleidoscopic background and wonderful scenes.
					
					It made its debut in Juche 91 (2002) to commemorate the 90th birth anniversary of President 
						Kim Il Sung.
					
					Since then it has been performed several hundred times, enjoyed by a total of 12,127,000 people, including 118,000 foreigners. 
					
					 It was registered in the Guinness Book of World Records in August 2007 and was the first to receive Peace Order and its diploma in April of the same year since it was instituted by "Protectors of Arts for the Century", a Russian international charity fund, to appreciate epoch-making masterpieces, inventions and works.  
					
					 The U.S. magazine "Time" also selected "Arirang" as the best work of Asia in 2008. 
					
					 "Arirang" is recognized as cultural asset of humankind.

articles.title: Xiaohaerbaling Meeting
articles.content:
Xiaohaerbaling Meeting
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- On August 10 and 11, Juche 29 (1940) President Kim Il Sung convened a meeting of military and political cadres of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) at Xiaohaerbaling, Dunhua County.
					 At the meeting the President put forward a policy of switching over to small-unit operations from large-unit ones to successfully carry out a new strategic task for preparing for a great event of national liberation.
					
					 At that time the Japanese imperialists were making frantic efforts to spread the flames of war to Southeast Asia and invade the Soviet Union in a bid to realise their ambition for the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere", even though they were still engaged in aggression on mainland China.
					
					 They, finding it impossible to conduct simultaneous operations against the Soviet Union and China and dominate Asia without annihilating the KPRA, launched a large-scale "punitive" offensive against it.
					
					 If the KPRA had continued to fight the enemy with large-unit operations, it would have resulted in benefiting the enemy in their attempt to weaken and wipe out the revolutionary army.
					
					 That is why the President advanced the afore-said policy with a view to preserving and expanding the forces of the KPRA while delivering ceaseless strikes at the enemy.
					
					 After the meeting the main unit of the KPRA was the first to form small units and political work teams by properly combining political and military cadres, veterans and recruits in a short span of time.
					
					 Small units were formed successfully in other units as well with regular command and liaison systems established and bases of small units and political work teams built up. 
					
					 The KPRA, in line with the strategic policy laid down at the Xiaohaerbaling meeting, started small-unit operations, giving successive blows to the enemy and preserving and expanding its forces.

articles.title: Japan Censured by Korean A-bomb Victims
articles.content:
Japan Censured by Korean A-bomb Victims
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Sixty-five years has passed since the United States A-bombed Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki on August 6 and 9, 1945.
					 Among the victims were many Koreans. They have lambasted Japan for refusing to admit its responsibility for their misfortune and make apology and compensation. 
					
					 The Korean victims are those forcibly brought to Hiroshima, Nagasaki and other places of Japan for slave labor during the period of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and their descendants.
					
					 Pyon Kap Ok, a 73-year-old woman who lives in Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 A few days after Hiroshima was hit by an A-bomb on August 6, 1945 the lower half of my body began to be swollen and I felt a high fever, headache and nausea. 
					
					 After returning to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea I was hospitalized for paraplegia for 14 months. Though sixty-five years has elapsed, I have still been gnawed by pain with my legs always swollen and bloody pus oozing out from skin.
					
					 My son, who had long been harassed by headache and skin disease since his birth, died from meningitis three years ago.
					
					 Another victim U Chun Mi, a 65-year-old resident in Pyongyang, said:
					
					I suffered injury from an A-bomb when I was four months old. 
					
					 Later, I have been troubled with such diseases as asthma, laryngitis, gastroptosis, colitis and then poor function of liver.
					
					 When I returned to the motherland in 1961, I wanted to work hard for it but I couldn't do so because of my diseases. 
					
					 I have a son and a daughter but they have been afflicted with dermatitis from their childhood.
					
					 It was due to Japan's forcible draft that Koreans, nonbelligerent with the United States, were victimized by it's A-bombs.
					
					 Japan is obliged to apologize to the Korean victims and take necessary measures for their treatment.

articles.title: Unity of S. Korean Progressive Forces Called for
articles.content:
Unity of S. Korean Progressive Forces Called for
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The progressive forces of south Korea aspiring after social progress, the improved inter-Korean relations and the country's reunification should unite close under the one banner in order to foil the moves of the south Korean group of traitors, Rodong Sinmun Monday urges in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 In order to smash the evermore undisguised treacherous moves of the reactionary conservative forces all the progressive forces of south Korea should positively achieve solidarity and alliance irrespective of ideology, affiliation and religion. 
					
					 The results of the "elections to local self-governing bodies" held last June reinforced the faith that the south Korean people can certainly overpower any dictatorial forces when they go united in their actions and, at the same time, taught a lesson that they should wage an uncompromising stubborn struggle against the conservative forces till they are eliminated. 
					
					 The united dynamic actions staged by the progressive forces of south Korea against the "government" and the "Grand National Party" forced the group of traitors to suffer a bitter crushing defeat in the "elections to local self-governing bodies." 
					
					 Independence, democracy and reunification are what the south Korean people unanimously desire. The progressive forces of south Korea are calling for independence, democracy and reunification though they differ from each other in ideology and ism. Independence, democracy and reunification, therefore, serve as a banner common to the progressive forces of south Korea.
					
					 Independence, democracy and reunification so much desired by the south Korean people will certainly come true when the progressive forces deal by dint of unity and overwhelming superiority sledge-hammer blows at the reactionary conservative forces standing in the way of the independence and democracy of society and national reunification.

articles.title: Juche-based Industry of DPRK
articles.content:
Juche-based Industry of DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The Juche-based industry of the DPRK remains a mainstay of the independent national economy built by the Korean people in the course of the arduous revolution under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea and the leader and provides a sure guarantee for building an economic power.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a signed article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It also provides a material guarantee for bringing about a great surge in production in every field of national economy, serves as a reliable boon to dynamically accelerating its modernization and a powerful treasured sword for resolutely foiling the persistent economic blockade and sanctions of the imperialists. 
					
					 The above-said industry is the most reliable and vital industry as it is developing in reliance upon its scientific and technical forces, locally available raw materials and resources. 
					
					 Satellites were successfully put into orbit, leaping progress has been made in putting machine-building industry on a CNC basis and Juche iron, Juche vinalon and Juche fertilizers are being mass-produced. All this is a striking demonstration of the might of the Juche-based industry of the DPRK.
					
					 It is an industry having its own perfect departmental structures of national economy and an independent industry capable of standing on its own feet under any difficult situation. Having this industry strong in Juche character and independent character, the DPRK reacts to the brigandish acts of the imperialists with a toughest stand and remains unfazed by any sanctions and blockade.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Urged to Step down in S. Korea
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Urged to Step down in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Paek Ki Wan, chief of the Unification Study Center, O Jong Ryol, permanent advisor of the Solidarity for Progress, Ri So Son, advisor of the Council of Bereaved Families for the Nation and Democracy, and other personages of south Korea made public a 100-people declaration on the situation on Aug. 5, demanding the resignation of traitor Lee Myung Bak.
					 The declaration charged that since its emergence the Lee regime has been engaged in the moves to stamp out democracy, deteriorate the people's livelihood and escalate the confrontation between the south and the north.
					
					 It demanded that the Lee regime thoroughly probe the truth about the warship sinking case, immediately stop the project for "improving four large rivers" and apologize for the crackdown committed under the pretext of public security and the illegal investigation into civilians.
					
					 It warned that if Lee persists in the dictatorial rule, all the people would turn out in the struggle for forcing the present "government" to step down.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Escalating Military Tension
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Escalating Military Tension
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee for "the August 15 Rally for Probe into the Truth about Warship 'Cheonan' Case and Peace on the Korean Peninsula" made up of more than 30 political parties and organizations of south Korea including the Democratic Labor Party and the Solidarity for Progress called a press conference in Seoul on August 5 to condemn the south Korean puppet group of traitors for escalating the military tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Speakers at the press conference noted that the south-north dialogue and exchanges are suspended and the military tension is increasing as the days go by at a time when the nation is greeting the 65th anniversary of August 15 liberation of Korea.
					
					 They accused the authorities of persisting in their policy of confrontation with the DPRK, still insisting on the "results of investigation" beset with distortions and doubts, far from making efforts for a thorough probe into the truth behind the "Cheonan" case.
					
					 They lashed out at the authorities for contemplating staging joint military exercises for invading the DPRK together with the U.S. in the future, increasing the likelihood of the tension and confrontation between the south and the north leading to military conflicts and pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst phase.
					
					 They declared people from all walks of life would launch actions against the Lee Myung Bak regime's moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK on the occasion of the liberation day.
					
					 They clarified that through these actions they would demand the authorities stop the joint military exercises with the U.S., resume the south-north dialogue, ensure cooperation and exchanges between nongovernmental organizations in the south and the north and implement the June 15 joint declaration, etc.

articles.title: Actions for Rights of Korean Schoolchildren in Japan
articles.content:
Actions for Rights of Korean Schoolchildren in Japan
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Japan and Japanese people are continuing their joint actions in demand of equal rights of Korean schoolchildren in Japan.
					 Representatives of the Students' Society for Japan-Korea Friendship called at the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan on August 4 to strongly demand an immediate measure for aiding Korean schools. 
					
					 In a written request they called for providing the Korean schoolchildren with the right to learning, noting that the discrimination policy of the Japanese government is creating tendency of national chauvinism in the whole society.
					
					 The Japanese government should solve in a responsible manner the issue of aiding the Korean schools at an early date to meet the purport of the tuition-free program for senior high schools, they stressed.
					
					 An Jung Gun, principal of Gunma Korean Junior Middle School, and other school officials, officials of the Gunma Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and the secretary general of the Gunma Prefectural Council for Japan-Korea Friendship and Solidarity visited the said ministry on the same day to convey the written request addressed to the Japanese prime minister and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology and the signature paper endorsed by more than 3,400 people.
					
					 Noting that public opinion supporting Korean schools is growing stronger in society, they urged the Japanese authorities to make a proper decision on this problem.

articles.title: Clausurada la exhibicion nacional de exitos logrados en la medicina
articles.content:
Clausurada la exhibicion nacional de exitos logrados en la medicina
Pyongyang, 9 de agosto (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 2 al 9 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la XIII Exhibicion Nacional de Exitos Cientificos y Tecnologicos del Sector de Salud Publica.
					En la ocasion fueron expuestos en compania de tablas graficas y multimedias mas de 2 mil 500 exitos logrados por los cientificos, tecnicos y funcionarios de los organos sanitarios y empresas a todos niveles.
					
					En el periodo de la exhibicion se efectuaron una serie de actividades como la presentacion cientifico-tecnologica, el intercambio de informaciones, etc.
					
					"Medicina preventiva para proteger al hombre de las sustancias de gripe aviar" y otras disertaciones de mucho valor para profilaxis y diagnosis fueron acogidas con placer por los visitantes.
					
					Por otra parte, centraron la atencion de los participantes los aparatos medicos y medicamentos como el "medidor portatil digital por CO" y el "instrumento para la operacion de ablacion del higado".
					
					La ceremonia de clausura tuvo lugar el dia 9.

articles.title: Inaugurados nuevos procesos en Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero
articles.content:
Inaugurados nuevos procesos en Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero
Pyongyang, 9 de agosto (ATCC) -- Entraron en funcionamiento los modernos procesos de estiramiento e hilatura acondicionados nuevamente en el Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero.
					Gracias a la inauguracion de ellos, fue sentada la base para normalizar en un alto nivel la produccion de hilos y telas de vinalon de buena calidad, lo cual contribuira al desarrollo economico del pais y al mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Los funcionarios y los trabajadores del complejo iniciaron la obra a principios de mayo pasado y la terminaron mucho antes que el plazo previsto, al promover a la vez la reconstruccion del edificio, la obra de infraestructura, etc.
					
					Por otra parte, el complejo resolvio los problemas cientifico-tecnicos en colaboracion con los cientificos del Instituto de Proyectos Quimicos de Hamhung y la Filial de Hamhung de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias y llevo a cabo en un corto periodo el traslado y la instalacion de decenas de equipos.

articles.title: Victimas de bombas atomicas condenan a los criminales
articles.content:
Victimas de bombas atomicas condenan a los criminales
Pyongyang, 9 de agosto (ATCC) -- Ya han transcurrido 65 anos desde cuando Estados Unidos lanzo los dias 6 y 9 de agosto de 1945 bombas atomicas sobre Hiroshima y Nagasaki de Japon. 
					Ahora las victimas coreanas de bombas atomicas estan muy indignadas por los reaccionarios japoneses que no reconocen su responsabilidad ni quieren pedir disculpas ni indemnizar debidamente.
					
					Las victimas coreanas son los que en el periodo de dominacion colonial de los imperialistas japoneses, fueron trasladados en contra de su voluntad a Hiroshima, Nagasaki y otras localidades de Japon, donde fueron sometidos a los trabajos de esclavitud, y sus descendientes. 
					
					Pyon Kap Ok (de 73 anos de edad, moradora de Pyongyang) se queja asi de sus sufrimientos a causa de la bomba atomica lanzada el 6 de agosto de 1945:
					
					Unos dias despues, la parte inferior de mi cuerpo comenzo a inflamarse y me senti trastornada por alta fiebre, cefalea y nausea. 
					
					Despues de regresar a la patria, estuve hospitalizada durante 14 meses por paraplejia.
					
					Hasta ahora vivo sufriendo la inflamacion de piernas y la sanie de cutis.
					
					Tuve un hijo, pero el padecia desde su nacimiento la cefalea, la dermatitis y otras enfermedades y murio hace 3 anos por meningitis.
					
					La otra victima U Chun Mi (de 65 anos, quien vive en Pyongyang) hizo las siguientes declaraciones:
					
					He sido la victima de bombas atomicas a los 4 meses de nacida.
					
					Al crecer, tuve el asma bronquial y otras enfermedades como la laringitis, la gastroptosis y la inflamacion de intestino grueso y esto me ha debilitado el higado.
					
					Me repatrie en 1961 y aunque tenia las ganas de trabajar mucho por esta patria generosa (RPDC), era incapacitada desde entonces.
					
					Mis hijos, un varon y una nina, tambien padecieron desde ninez la dermatitis.
					
					Aunque Corea no fue pais beligerante de EE.UU., los coreanos sufrieron mucho por las bombas atomicas debido al crimen de arresto forzado de los imperialistas japoneses. 
					
					Japon debe pedir perdon a todas las victimas coreanas de bombas atomicas y tomar medidas urgentes para brindarles la necesaria asistencia medica.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda unidad de fuerzas progresistas surcoreanas
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda unidad de fuerzas progresistas surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 9 de agosto (ATCC) -- Para frustrar las maniobras de la banda de traidores surcoreanos, las fuerzas progresistas del Sur de Corea, que desean el progreso social, la mejora de las relaciones entre ambas partes de Corea y la reunificacion del pais, deben unirse compactamente bajo la unica bandera.
					Asi subraya el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este lunes y continua:
					
					A fin de llevar al fracaso las cada dia mas siniestras acciones vendepatrias de las fuerzas conservadoras reaccionarias, todas las fuerzas progresistas del Sur de Corea deben solidarizarse y unirse activamente por encima de las diferencias de ideales, pertenencias y religiones.
					
					A traves del resultado de las "elecciones de autonomia local" celebradas en junio pasado, el pueblo surcoreano llego a convencerse de que si lucha unido, puede vencer a cualesquier fuerzas dictatoriales. Al mismo tiempo, aprendio la leccion de que la lucha contra las fuerzas conservadoras no debe parar hasta que alcance la victoria final. Puesto que las fuerzas progresistas surcoreanas intensificaron unidas la lucha contra el "gobierno" y el "Gran Partido Nacional", la banda de traidores sufrio una amarga derrota en dichas "elecciones".
					
					La independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion son la unanime aspiracion y deseo de los habitantes surcoreanos. Las demandan todas las fuerzas progresistas aunque existen diferencias de criterios y doctrinas entre ellas. De veras, ellas constituyen la bandera comun de las fuerzas progresistas.
					
					Cuando las fuerzas progresistas castiguen severamente con la unidad y la superioridad absoluta a los conservadores reaccionarios que impiden la independencia y la democratizacion de la sociedad y la reunificacion de la patria, los habitantes surcoreanos realizaran sin falta su deseo de la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion.
